title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Previously to this, liowever, the regalia had been secretly conveyed away, and buried beneath the pulpit of the church of Kinneff, by Jlrs.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: His lady, who had beenactive in the stratagem, was subjected to similarseverities, as were also the minister of Kinneff andhis courageous spouse.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Arriving with her preciouscharge at Kinneff, the minister buried the relics ofroyalty under the pulpit of his church, and visitedthem from time to lime, in order to wrap them infresh packages, and preserve them from injury.

title: The Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott. (Supplementary volume: containing notes, historical and illustrative, by the author, glossary, etc.)
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: As their provisionsbegan to fail, the Governor foresaw that farther defence must speedily become impossible; and, withthe assistance of Mr Granger, minister of Kinneff,he formed a stratagem for securing the ancient andvenerable regalia from the dishonour which threatened them.
